body.p:
Greenville Ky Feby 8th 1864
His Excellency Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky

Sir By recent enactments of the Genl Assembly you are authorized to raise and equip five regiments of mounted Infty for purposes of State defence I propose to be one of the numerous applicants for authority to raise one of those Regts.

As regards my integrity of character, firmness of purpose, ability and aptness to command and experience in such matters I respectfully refer you to Maj. T. L. Crittenden, Col. Cicero Maxwell of 26th Ky Vol Infty. Col P. Butler Hawkins, formerly of 11th Ky Vol Infty and to any or all of the present officers & men of said Regiment; in which I have served as Capt. of Company for near two years-

Should this application meet with your approval I suggest the Southern portion of the State as the field of my operations, with camps
of organization and instruction at Hopkinsville Russellville and Greenville or at such other points as may be deemed most expedient

Very Respectfully
Your Obt. Sevnt
M. Jeff. Roark

Greenville Ky
8th Feby 1864
Muhlenberg Co.
Roark, M. Jeff
Application to raise one of the five regiments authorized for State defense. Refers to Maj Genl Grittenden Col P. B Hawkins & Cicero Maxwell for ability &c

Boyle
Recd A. G. O 11th Feby 1864
